name.japanese: ポートガス・D・エース

keyMoments.title: Emotional Farewell to Whitebeard
keyMoments.description: Ace shares a final, emotional farewell with Whitebeard, expressing deep gratitude for being accepted and loved despite being the Pirate King's son.
keyMoments.significance: Ace's last conversation with the father figure who gave him purpose and acceptance, highlighting their bond before tragedy strikes.

keyMoments.title: Turning Back to Confront Akainu
keyMoments.description: Unable to tolerate insults toward Whitebeard, Ace stops his escape and turns to confront Akainu in rage, despite warnings from his crewmates.
keyMoments.significance: The fatal decision that reveals Ace's character flaw - his inability to ignore insults to those he loves, choosing honor over survival.
keyMoments.quote: Take that back! Pops is the man who gave me everything! I won't let you disrespect him!

keyMoments.title: Fire Fist vs Magma
keyMoments.description: Ace's Fire Fist attack is completely overpowered and consumed by Akainu's magma, revealing the hierarchy between their Devil Fruits.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates that Ace is fundamentally outmatched against Akainu due to the natural superiority of magma over fire.

keyMoments.title: Sacrifices Himself to Shield Luffy
keyMoments.description: Ace throws himself in front of Akainu's magma punch to protect Luffy, taking a fatal blow through his chest that burns his vital organs.
keyMoments.significance: Ace's ultimate sacrifice for his brother, fulfilling his promise to never let Luffy die. One of the most pivotal moments in One Piece history.

reveals.information: Ace's Mera Mera no Mi flames are inferior to Akainu's Magu Magu no Mi magma, leaving him defenseless in direct combat
Ace's inability to ignore insults to Whitebeard's honor proves to be his fatal weakness, overriding his survival instinct

keyMoments.title: Insults Whitebeard to Provoke Ace
keyMoments.description: Akainu deliberately taunts and insults Whitebeard, calling him a loser and washed-up failure, specifically to provoke Ace into abandoning his escape.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Akainu's ruthless psychological warfare tactics and his understanding of Ace's emotional vulnerabilities.
keyMoments.quote: Whitebeard is nothing but a loser from a bygone era! He's a washed-up failure who will never surpass the Pirate King!

keyMoments.title: Magma Overpowers Fire
keyMoments.description: Akainu demonstrates that his magma can burn and consume Ace's fire, revealing the power hierarchy between their Devil Fruits.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the superiority of the Magu Magu no Mi over the Mera Mera no Mi based on scientific principles.
keyMoments.quote: My magma can even burn your flames! Our abilities are on completely different levels! Magu Magu is the superior fruit!

keyMoments.title: Delivers Fatal Blow to Ace
keyMoments.description: While targeting Luffy, Akainu's magma fist pierces through Ace's chest when Ace shields his brother, fatally wounding the Fire Fist.
keyMoments.significance: Akainu becomes the man who killed the Pirate King's son, cementing his role as one of the series' most ruthless antagonists.

reveals.information: Akainu's Magu Magu no Mi magma burns at temperatures hot enough to consume and overpower fire itself
Akainu uses deliberate psychological manipulation to provoke emotional opponents into making fatal mistakes
Akainu sees Luffy as Dragon's son and a future threat that must be eliminated at all costs

keyMoments.title: Targeted by Akainu While Exhausted
keyMoments.description: Completely drained from his efforts, Luffy becomes the target of Akainu's fatal magma attack as the Admiral seeks to eliminate Dragon's son.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Luffy at his most vulnerable and powerless, unable to protect himself or his brother.

keyMoments.title: Saved by Ace's Sacrifice
keyMoments.description: Luffy is saved from Akainu's fatal blow when Ace throws himself in front of the attack, taking the lethal magma punch meant for him.
keyMoments.significance: The beginning of Luffy's greatest trauma - witnessing his brother die to save him, an event that will fundamentally change his character.

name.japanese: エドワード・ニューゲート

keyMoments.title: Orders Full Evacuation
keyMoments.description: Whitebeard gives his final captain's order, commanding all his crew and allied pirates to evacuate while he covers their retreat.
keyMoments.significance: Whitebeard's final order as captain demonstrates his role as a protective father figure willing to sacrifice himself for his sons.
keyMoments.quote: You brats, listen up! From here on, I'm giving my final captain's order! We're going our separate ways!

keyMoments.title: Final Moment with Ace
keyMoments.description: Shares a final emotional moment with Ace as his adopted son thanks him before attempting to escape.
keyMoments.significance: The last interaction between Whitebeard and Ace, highlighting their deep father-son bond.

keyMoments.title: Tries to Stop Ace
keyMoments.description: Marco desperately tries to warn Ace not to fall for Akainu's provocation, understanding it's a deliberate trap.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Marco's tactical awareness and his concern for his fellow division commander.
keyMoments.quote: Ace, don't! It's what he wants!

keyMoments.title: First Appearance at Marineford
keyMoments.description: Agsilly appears as a member of the Whitebeard Pirates during the evacuation of Marineford.
keyMoments.significance: Minor character debut showing another member of Whitebeard's crew.
